00030 template <typename signature>
00031 struct fn_container{
00032   signature function;
00033 };
00034 
00035 #define TLM_DEFINE_FUNCTOR(name) \
00036 template <typename MODULE, typename TRAITS> \
00037 inline TLM_RET_VAL static_##name( void* mod \
00038                                        , void* fn \
00039                                        , int index \
00040                                        , TLM_FULL_ARG_LIST) \
00041 { \
00042   typedef fn_container<TLM_RET_VAL (MODULE::*)(int, TLM_FULL_ARG_LIST)> fn_container_type; \
00043   MODULE* tmp_mod=static_cast<MODULE*>(mod); \
00044   fn_container_type* tmp_cb =static_cast<fn_container_type*> (fn); \
00045   return (tmp_mod->*(tmp_cb->function))(index, TLM_ARG_LIST_WITHOUT_TYPES); \
00046 }\
00047 \
00048 template <typename MODULE, typename TRAITS> \
00049 inline void delete_fn_container_of_##name(void* fn) \
00050 { \
00051   typedef fn_container<TLM_RET_VAL (MODULE::*)(int, TLM_FULL_ARG_LIST)> fn_container_type; \
00052   fn_container_type* tmp_cb =static_cast<fn_container_type*> (fn); \
00053   if (tmp_cb) delete tmp_cb;\
00054 } \
00055 \
00056 template <typename TRAITS> \
00057 class name##_functor{ \
00058 public: \
00059   typedef typename TRAITS::tlm_payload_type payload_type; \
00060   typedef typename TRAITS::tlm_phase_type   phase_type; \
00061   typedef TLM_RET_VAL (*call_fn)(void*,void*, int, TLM_FULL_ARG_LIST); \
00062   typedef void (*del_fn)(void*); \
00063 \
00064   name##_functor(): m_fn(0), m_del_fn(0), m_mod(0), m_mem_fn(0){} \
00065   ~name##_functor(){if (m_del_fn) (*m_del_fn)(m_mem_fn);}  \
00066 \
00067   template <typename MODULE> \
00068   void set_function(MODULE* mod, TLM_RET_VAL (MODULE::*cb)(int, TLM_FULL_ARG_LIST)){ \
00069     typedef fn_container<TLM_RET_VAL (MODULE::*)(int, TLM_FULL_ARG_LIST)> fn_container_type; \
00070     m_fn=&static_##name<MODULE,TRAITS>;\
00071     m_del_fn=&delete_fn_container_of_##name<MODULE,TRAITS>;\
00072     m_del_fn(m_mem_fn); \
00073     fn_container_type* tmp= new fn_container_type(); \
00074     tmp->function=cb; \
00075     m_mod=static_cast<void*>(mod); \
00076     m_mem_fn=static_cast<void*>(tmp); \
00077   } \
00078   \
00079   TLM_RET_VAL operator()(int index, TLM_FULL_ARG_LIST){ \
00080     return m_fn(m_mod,m_mem_fn, index, TLM_ARG_LIST_WITHOUT_TYPES); \
00081   } \
00082 \
00083   bool is_valid(){return (m_mod!=0 && m_mem_fn!=0 && m_fn!=0);}\
00084 \
00085 protected: \
00086   call_fn m_fn;\
00087   del_fn m_del_fn; \
00088   void* m_mod; \
00089   void* m_mem_fn; \
00090 private: \
00091   name##_functor& operator=(const name##_functor&); \
00092 }
00093 
00094 
00095 #define TLM_RET_VAL tlm::tlm_sync_enum
00096 #define TLM_FULL_ARG_LIST typename TRAITS::tlm_payload_type& txn, typename TRAITS::tlm_phase_type& ph, sc_core::sc_time& t
00097 #define TLM_ARG_LIST_WITHOUT_TYPES txn,ph,t
00098 TLM_DEFINE_FUNCTOR(nb_transport);
00099 #undef TLM_RET_VAL
00100 #undef TLM_FULL_ARG_LIST
00101 #undef TLM_ARG_LIST_WITHOUT_TYPES
00102 
00103 #define TLM_RET_VAL void
00104 #define TLM_FULL_ARG_LIST typename TRAITS::tlm_payload_type& txn, sc_core::sc_time& t
00105 #define TLM_ARG_LIST_WITHOUT_TYPES txn,t
00106 TLM_DEFINE_FUNCTOR(b_transport);
00107 #undef TLM_RET_VAL
00108 #undef TLM_FULL_ARG_LIST
00109 #undef TLM_ARG_LIST_WITHOUT_TYPES
00110 
00111 #define TLM_RET_VAL unsigned int
00112 #define TLM_FULL_ARG_LIST typename TRAITS::tlm_payload_type& txn
00113 #define TLM_ARG_LIST_WITHOUT_TYPES txn
00114 TLM_DEFINE_FUNCTOR(debug_transport);
00115 #undef TLM_RET_VAL
00116 #undef TLM_FULL_ARG_LIST
00117 #undef TLM_ARG_LIST_WITHOUT_TYPES
00118 
00119 #define TLM_RET_VAL bool
00120 #define TLM_FULL_ARG_LIST typename TRAITS::tlm_payload_type& txn, tlm::tlm_dmi& dmi
00121 #define TLM_ARG_LIST_WITHOUT_TYPES txn,dmi
00122 TLM_DEFINE_FUNCTOR(get_dmi_ptr);
00123 #undef TLM_RET_VAL
00124 #undef TLM_FULL_ARG_LIST
00125 #undef TLM_ARG_LIST_WITHOUT_TYPES
00126 
00127 #define TLM_RET_VAL void
00128 #define TLM_FULL_ARG_LIST sc_dt::uint64 l, sc_dt::uint64 u
00129 #define TLM_ARG_LIST_WITHOUT_TYPES l,u
00130 TLM_DEFINE_FUNCTOR(invalidate_dmi);
00131 #undef TLM_RET_VAL
00132 #undef TLM_FULL_ARG_LIST
00133 #undef TLM_ARG_LIST_WITHOUT_TYPES
00134 
00135 #undef TLM_DEFINE_FUNCTOR

00137 /*
00138 This class implements the fw interface.
00139 It allows to register a callback for each of the fw interface methods.
00140 The callbacks simply forward the fw interface call, but add the id (an int)
00141 of the callback binder to the signature of the call.
00142 */
00143 template <typename TYPES>
00144 class callback_binder_fw
00145   : public tlm::tlm_fw_transport_if<TYPES>
00146   , protected convenience_socket_cb_holder
00147 {
00148   public:
00149     //typedefs according to the used TYPES class
00150     typedef typename TYPES::tlm_payload_type              transaction_type;
00151     typedef typename TYPES::tlm_phase_type                phase_type;  
00152     typedef tlm::tlm_sync_enum                            sync_enum_type;
00153   
00154     //typedefs for the callbacks
00155     typedef nb_transport_functor<TYPES>    nb_func_type;
00156     typedef b_transport_functor<TYPES>     b_func_type;
00157     typedef debug_transport_functor<TYPES> debug_func_type;
00158     typedef get_dmi_ptr_functor<TYPES>     dmi_func_type;
00159 
00160     //ctor: an ID is needed to create a callback binder
00161     callback_binder_fw(multi_socket_base* owner, int id)
00162       : convenience_socket_cb_holder(owner), m_id(id)
00163       , m_nb_f(0), m_b_f(0), m_dbg_f(0), m_dmi_f(0)
00164       , m_caller_port(0)
00165     {}
00166 
00167     //the nb_transport method of the fw interface
00168     sync_enum_type nb_transport_fw(transaction_type& txn,
00169                                 phase_type& p,
00170                                 sc_core::sc_time& t){
00171       //check if a callback is registered
00172       if (m_nb_f && m_nb_f->is_valid()) {
00173         return (*m_nb_f)(m_id, txn, p, t); //do the callback
00174       }
00175 
00176       display_error("Call to nb_transport_fw without a registered callback for nb_transport_fw.");
00177       return tlm::TLM_COMPLETED;
00178     }
00179 
00180     //the b_transport method of the fw interface
00181     void b_transport(transaction_type& trans,sc_core::sc_time& t){
00182       //check if a callback is registered
00183       if (m_b_f && m_b_f->is_valid()) {
00184         (*m_b_f)(m_id, trans,t); //do the callback
00185         return;
00186       }
00187 
00188       display_error("Call to b_transport without a registered callback for b_transport.");
00189     }
00190     
00191     //the DMI method of the fw interface
00192     bool get_direct_mem_ptr(transaction_type& trans, tlm::tlm_dmi&  dmi_data){
00193       //check if a callback is registered
00194       if (m_dmi_f && m_dmi_f->is_valid()) {
00195         return (*m_dmi_f)(m_id, trans,dmi_data); //do the callback
00196       }
00197 
00198       dmi_data.allow_none();
00199       dmi_data.set_start_address(0x0);
00200       dmi_data.set_end_address((sc_dt::uint64)-1);
00201       return false;
00202     }
00203     
00204     //the debug method of the fw interface
00205     unsigned int transport_dbg(transaction_type& trans){
00206       //check if a callback is registered
00207       if (m_dbg_f && m_dbg_f->is_valid()) {
00208         return (*m_dbg_f)(m_id, trans); //do the callback
00209       }
00210 
00211       return 0;
00212     }
00213     
00214     //the SystemC standard callback register_port:
00215     // - called when a port if bound to the interface
00216     // - allowd to find out who is bound to that callback binder
00217     void register_port(sc_core::sc_port_base& b, const char* /*name*/){
00218       m_caller_port=&b;
00219     }
00220     
00221     //register callbacks for all fw interface methods at once
00222     void set_callbacks(nb_func_type& cb1, b_func_type& cb2, dmi_func_type& cb3, debug_func_type& cb4){
00223       m_nb_f=&cb1;
00224       m_b_f=&cb2;
00225       m_dmi_f=&cb3;
00226       m_dbg_f=&cb4;
00227     }
00228     
00229     //getter method to get the port that is bound to that callback binder
00230     // NOTE: this will only return a valid value at end of elaboration
00231     //  (but not before end of elaboration!)
00232     sc_core::sc_port_base* get_other_side(){return m_caller_port;}
00233     
00234   private:
00235     //the ID of the callback binder
00236     int m_id; 
00237     
00238     //the callbacks
00239     nb_func_type* m_nb_f; 
00240     b_func_type*  m_b_f;
00241     debug_func_type* m_dbg_f;
00242     dmi_func_type* m_dmi_f;
00243     
00244     //the port bound to that callback binder
00245     sc_core::sc_port_base* m_caller_port;   
00246 };
00247 
00248 /*
00249 This class implements the bw interface.
00250 It allows to register a callback for each of the bw interface methods.
00251 The callbacks simply forward the bw interface call, but add the id (an int)
00252 of the callback binder to the signature of the call.
00253 */
00254 template <typename TYPES>
00255 class callback_binder_bw
00256   : public tlm::tlm_bw_transport_if<TYPES>
00257   , protected convenience_socket_cb_holder
00258 {
00259   public:
00260     //typedefs according to the used TYPES class
00261     typedef typename TYPES::tlm_payload_type              transaction_type;
00262     typedef typename TYPES::tlm_phase_type                phase_type;  
00263     typedef tlm::tlm_sync_enum                            sync_enum_type;
00264   
00265     //typedefs for the callbacks
00266     typedef nb_transport_functor<TYPES>   nb_func_type;
00267     typedef invalidate_dmi_functor<TYPES> dmi_func_type;
00268 
00269     //ctor: an ID is needed to create a callback binder
00270     callback_binder_bw(multi_socket_base* owner, int id)
00271       : convenience_socket_cb_holder(owner), m_id(id)
00272       , m_nb_f(0), m_dmi_f(0) {}
00273 
00274     //the nb_transport method of the bw interface
00275     sync_enum_type nb_transport_bw(transaction_type& txn,
00276                                 phase_type& p,
00277                                 sc_core::sc_time& t){
00278       //check if a callback is registered
00279       if (m_nb_f && m_nb_f->is_valid()) {
00280         return (*m_nb_f)(m_id, txn, p, t); //do the callback
00281       }
00282 
00283       display_error("Call to nb_transport_bw without a registered callback for nb_transport_bw");
00284       return tlm::TLM_COMPLETED;
00285     }
00286     
00287     //the DMI method of the bw interface
00288     void invalidate_direct_mem_ptr(sc_dt::uint64 l, sc_dt::uint64 u){
00289       //check if a callback is registered
00290       if (m_dmi_f && m_dmi_f->is_valid()) {
00291         (*m_dmi_f)(m_id,l,u); //do the callback
00292       }
00293     }
00294 
00295     //register callbacks for all bw interface methods at once
00296     void set_callbacks(nb_func_type& cb1, dmi_func_type& cb2){
00297       m_nb_f=&cb1;
00298       m_dmi_f=&cb2;
00299     }
00300     
00301   private:
00302     //the ID of the callback binder
00303     int m_id;
00304     //the callbacks
00305     nb_func_type* m_nb_f;
00306     dmi_func_type* m_dmi_f;
00307 };
00308 
00309 /*
00310 This class forms the base for multi initiator sockets,
00311 with fewer template parameters than the multi_init_base.
00312 This class is implementation-defined.
00313 */
00314 template <typename TYPES = tlm::tlm_base_protocol_types>
00315 class multi_init_base_if {
00316 public:
00317   //this method shall return a vector of the callback binders of multi initiator socket
00318   virtual std::vector<callback_binder_bw<TYPES>* >& get_binders()=0;
00319   //this method shall return a vector of all target interfaces bound to this multi init socket
00320   virtual std::vector<tlm::tlm_fw_transport_if<TYPES>*>& get_sockets()=0;
00321 protected:
00322   virtual ~multi_init_base_if() {}
00323 };
00324 
00325 /*
00326 This class forms the base for multi initiator sockets.
00327 It enforces a multi initiator socket to implement all functions
00328 needed to do hierarchical bindings.
00329 */
00330 template <unsigned int BUSWIDTH = 32,
00331           typename TYPES = tlm::tlm_base_protocol_types,
00332           unsigned int N=0,
00333           sc_core::sc_port_policy POL = sc_core::SC_ONE_OR_MORE_BOUND>
00334 class multi_init_base
00335   : public tlm::tlm_initiator_socket<BUSWIDTH, TYPES, N, POL>
00336   , public multi_init_base_if<TYPES>
00337   , protected multi_socket_base
00338 {
00339 public:
00340   //typedef for the base type: the standard tlm initiator socket
00341   typedef tlm::tlm_initiator_socket<BUSWIDTH, TYPES, N, POL> base_type;
00342   
00343   //this method shall disable the code that does the callback binding
00344   // that registers callbacks to binders
00345   virtual void disable_cb_bind()=0;
00346   
00347   //this method shall return the multi_init_base to which the
00348   // multi_init_base is bound hierarchically
00349   //  If the base is not bound hierarchically it shall return a pointer to itself
00350   virtual multi_init_base* get_hierarch_bind()=0;
00351   
00352   virtual tlm::tlm_socket_category get_socket_category() const
00353   {
00354     return tlm::TLM_MULTI_INITIATOR_SOCKET;
00355   }
00356 
00357   //ctor and dtor
00358   virtual ~multi_init_base(){}
00359   multi_init_base():base_type(sc_core::sc_gen_unique_name("multi_init_base")){}
00360   multi_init_base(const char* name):base_type(name){}
00361 
00362 private:
00363   const sc_core::sc_object* get_socket() const { return this; }
00364 };
00365 
00366 /*
00367 This class forms the base for multi target sockets,
00368 with fewer template parameters than the multi_target_base.
00369 This class is implementation-defined.
00370 */
00371 template <typename TYPES = tlm::tlm_base_protocol_types>
00372 class multi_target_base_if {
00373 public:
00374   //this method shall return a vector of the callback binders of multi initiator socket
00375   virtual std::vector<callback_binder_fw<TYPES>* >& get_binders()=0;
00376   
00377   //this method shall return a map of all multi initiator sockets that are
00378   // bound to this multi target the key of the map is the index at which the
00379   // multi initiator i bound, while the value is the interface of the multi
00380   // initiator socket that is bound at that index
00381   virtual std::map<unsigned int, tlm::tlm_bw_transport_if<TYPES>*>& get_multi_binds()=0;
00382 protected:
00383   virtual ~multi_target_base_if() {}
00384 };
00385 
00386 /*
00387 This class forms the base for multi target sockets.
00388 It enforces a multi target socket to implement all functions
00389 needed to do hierarchical bindings.
00390 */
00391 template <unsigned int BUSWIDTH = 32,
00392           typename TYPES = tlm::tlm_base_protocol_types,
00393           unsigned int N=0,
00394           sc_core::sc_port_policy POL = sc_core::SC_ONE_OR_MORE_BOUND>
00395 class multi_target_base
00396   : public tlm::tlm_target_socket<BUSWIDTH, TYPES, N, POL>
00397   , public multi_target_base_if<TYPES>
00398   , protected multi_socket_base
00399 {
00400 public:
00401   //typedef for the base type: the standard tlm target socket
00402   typedef tlm::tlm_target_socket<BUSWIDTH, TYPES, N, POL > base_type;
00403   
00404   //this method shall return the multi_init_base to which the
00405   // multi_init_base is bound hierarchically
00406   //  If the base is not bound hierarchically it shall return a pointer to itself                                                
00407   virtual multi_target_base* get_hierarch_bind()=0;
00408   
00409   //this method shall inform the multi target socket that it is bound
00410   // hierarchically and to which other multi target socket it is bound hierarchically
00411   virtual void set_hierarch_bind(multi_target_base*)=0;
00412 
00413   virtual tlm::tlm_socket_category get_socket_category() const
00414   {
00415     return tlm::TLM_MULTI_TARGET_SOCKET;
00416   }
00417 
00418   //ctor and dtor
00419   virtual ~multi_target_base(){}
00420   multi_target_base():base_type(sc_core::sc_gen_unique_name("multi_target_base")){}
00421   multi_target_base(const char* name):base_type(name){}
00422 
00423 private:
00424   const sc_core::sc_object* get_socket() const { return this; }
00425 };
00426 
00427 /*
00428 All multi sockets must additionally derive from this class.
00429 It enforces a multi socket to implement a function 
00430 needed to do multi init to multi target bindings.
00431 */
00432 template <typename TYPES>
00433 class multi_to_multi_bind_base{
00434 public:
00435   virtual ~multi_to_multi_bind_base(){}
00436   virtual tlm::tlm_fw_transport_if<TYPES>* get_last_binder(tlm::tlm_bw_transport_if<TYPES>*)=0;
00437 };
